__TOC__

This page records the agenda for the next meeting of the <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-backporters|Ubuntu Backporters]]</nowiki> team, which handles the process and review for <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuBackports||Ubuntu Backports]]</nowiki>.

=== Where and When ===

Team meetings are held in the libera.chat IRC channel #ubuntu-meeting. To find the date and time of next meeting, please see the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuBackports/MeetingLogs|meeting logs page]]</nowiki>.

=== Agenda ===

==== Previous Action Items ====

* ddstreet
** ddstreet get DEB_VENDOR=ubuntu dch --bpo to DTRT pls (carried over)
** ddstreet look at reviewer tooling such as 'queue' or other tools for reviewing/accepting/rejecting uploads, and closing the corresponding bugs (carried over)
** ddstreet send short policy wording proposal to ML regarding https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-backports/2023-March/023030.html
** ddstreet ping email to keep thread alive: clarification on specific wording for no-bug-required backport exceptions
** ddstreet update exception list to add cockpit, cockpit-machines, cockpit-podman
** ddstreet review cockpit uploads to non-LTS releases
** ddstreet note in wiki exceptions are evalated on a case by case basis
** ddstreet email mapreri (and list) to pick next mtg date (probably in jan)
* teward
** teward make sure there are no bugs in requestbackport and backportpackage tools (in lunar) (carried over)
* mapreri
** mapreri upload (more of) all the tools (carried over, in progress)
** mapreri fix lintian to not complain about ~bpo suffix (https://bugs.debian.org/1001399) (carried over)
** mapreri review wiki page to see how we can highlight that backport requestors need to do the backport work and find a sponsor (carried over)
** mapreri start thread on ML about how to use bug status to define meaing in process (carried over)
* **UNASSIGNED**
** (unassigned) consider documenting an SLA for reviewing uploaded backport packages
** (unassigned) check if backports pocket uploads and/or approvals go to a ML (carried over)
** (unassigned) if no ML for backports uploads/approvals, check on how to create one (carried over)

=== Background ===

This team was rebooted after initial discussion in these threads:
* <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-devel/2021-July/041533.html|Proposal: sunset the backports pockets]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-devel/2021-July/041559.html|Plan to reform the Ubuntu Backporters Team]]</nowiki>
